metadata.objective: Explore how consumers make decisions about plant-based milk alternatives, focusing on the attributes that matter most to them

turns.question:
Thanks so much for joining me today! I'm really interested in learning about your experiences with plant-based milk alternatives – things like almond milk, oat milk, soy milk, and so on.

To get us started, can you walk me through the last time you were shopping for milk alternatives? What do you remember about that experience – where were you, what were you looking at, what was going through your mind?
turns.response: Oh yeah, I was actually at Whole Foods last week looking for oat milk. I spent a good amount of time in that aisle comparing labels – you know, checking the sugar content, making sure there weren't any weird additives or gums. I ended up going with the Oatly barista blend because it had minimal ingredients and no added oils, which I try to avoid. I remember there were so many options though, and honestly some of them had way more sugar than I expected for something that's supposed to be a healthier alternative.

turns.question: Why does avoiding those oils and additives matter to you?
turns.response: I try to avoid processed ingredients because I've read they can cause inflammation in the body, and I just feel better when I stick to cleaner foods. Like, my digestion is way better when I'm not consuming a bunch of additives, and I'm trying to be more mindful about what I'm putting into my body long-term, you know?

turns.question: What does taking care of your body long-term mean to you?
turns.response: For me, it's really about being intentional with what I put into my body every day. Like, I think about how the choices I make now - whether it's what I eat or drink - are going to affect my energy levels, my gut health, even how I age down the line. I try to focus on whole, minimally processed foods and ingredients I can actually recognize and pronounce, you know? It's not about being perfect, but just being mindful that my body is going to be with me for hopefully a long time, so I want to treat it well.

turns.question: Why is treating your body well important to you?
turns.response: You know, I feel like I only get one body, and I want it to last. I've noticed such a difference in my energy levels and just overall how I feel when I'm putting good things in versus processed stuff. Plus, my mom dealt with a lot of health issues that probably could've been prevented with better nutrition, so I'm trying to be more proactive about it now rather than dealing with problems later.

turns.question: How does choosing oat milk fit into being proactive about your health?
turns.response: I think it's about making intentional choices, you know? Like, I'm actively choosing something plant-based that's easier on my digestive system and has fiber, which is good for gut health. Plus, I'm avoiding the hormones and antibiotics that can be in regular dairy. It's one of those daily decisions that adds up - like, I'm not just reacting to feeling bad, I'm preventing issues before they start. And honestly, knowing it's fortified with vitamins D and B12 makes me feel like I'm actually nourishing my body, not just drinking something tasty.

turns.question: What does nourishing your body mean to you?
turns.response: I think it means being really intentional about what I'm putting into my body, you know? Like, choosing foods that give me sustained energy throughout the day and support my immune system. For me, it's about whole ingredients that my body can actually recognize and use - not just empty calories or processed stuff that might taste good but leaves me feeling sluggish. I want to feel good from the inside out.

turns.question: What does feeling good from the inside out give you in your daily life?
turns.response: I think it just gives me more energy to get through my day, you know? Like, I'm not dealing with that afternoon crash or feeling sluggish. When I'm fueling my body with the right stuff, I can actually focus at work and still have energy to hit the gym or meet up with friends after. It's kind of like... when your body feels good, everything else just flows better.

turns.question: Why does having things flow better matter to you?
turns.response: I mean, it's just about feeling good, you know? Like, when my digestion is working smoothly, I have more energy throughout the day and I'm not feeling bloated or sluggish. It affects everything - my workouts, my focus at work, even my mood. Plus, I think gut health is connected to so much else in the body, like immunity and inflammation, so keeping things regular is kind of foundational for overall wellness.

turns.question: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with me today. This has been very helpful.
turns.response: You're welcome! I'm glad I could help. It's nice to talk about products I actually care about – especially when it comes to what I'm putting in my body every day.
